items.title: Almond Milk
items.content_html:
From the bag.

Amount Ingredient
1 cup raw almonds
3 1/2 cups water
2 Medjool dates
1/2 tsp vanilla extract
1/4 tsp cinnamon
pinch sea salt

items.title: Thai Basil Chicken
items.summary: "Thai basil chicken, better known in Thai as pad kra pao gai (ผัดกระเพราไก่ pad ka prao gai), is a…
items.content_html: "Thai basil chicken, better known in Thai as pad kra pao gai (ผัดกระเพราไก่ pad ka prao gai), is a contender for the most popular, and the most beloved Thai street food dish of all time."

items.title: Tomato Soup
items.summary: For the Vitamix Rinse and chop tomatoes in half. Add ingredients in order (from top down). Blend for ~5…
items.content_html:
For the Vitamix

Amount Ingredient
1.5 cups Water
10 Roma tomatoes
10 baby carrots
small amount onion
dash thyme
several sprigs fresh basil
1/2 cup milk
? cream

Rinse and chop tomatoes in half. 

Add ingredients in order (from top down).

Blend for ~5 minutes to heat up. May need additional heat source.

Notes:

1/14/20 - not creamy/thick enough. May need to add cream (or replace milk with it). Check on other recipies for ideas.

items.title: Pecan Milk
items.summary: Pecan malk, cold brew coffee, is delicious. Notes:Buy raw, NOT pre-roasted nuts from the store1 cup = 4.4 oz…
items.content_html:
Pecan malk, cold brew coffee, is delicious. 

Notes:

  • Buy raw, NOT pre-roasted nuts from the store
  • 1 cup = 4.4 oz of pecans (around 1/4 lb.)
  • Raw pecans from bins at Central Market (11.99/lb), Whole Foods (12.99/lb)
  • So, 1 cup of pecans ~$3 = 36oz = 8.3 cents/oz.
  • vs. Malk ~4.04 = 28 oz = 14.4 cents/oz.
  • vs. regular milk ~2.50 = 128 oz = 2 cents/oz.

items.title: Oat Milk
items.summary: For drinking goodness. Blend just water and date (so can get date chopped up first). Then add oats and…
items.content_html:
For drinking goodness.

Amount Ingredient
3 cups water
1 Medjool date (pitted)
1/2 cup oats (quick/instant/rolled - NOT steel cut)
pinch salt

 Blend just water and date (so can get date chopped up first). Then add oats and blend for just 20-30 seconds (don't want to get too hot or gets thick/oatmealy).

Strain into jar.

items.title: Coconut Curry Chicken
items.summary: Made up, hope its good! Put coconut milk, sugar, and spices in instant pot. Add chicken (not on trivet).
items.content_html:
Made up, hope its good!

Amount Ingredient
2 cups Coconut milk (vanilla, unsweetened)
~1 tbs fresh cut ginger
2 tbs brown sugar
1 tbs curry
3/4 tbs salt
1/4 tsp cayenne
1/2 tsp garlic powder

 Put coconut milk, sugar, and spices in instant pot. Add chicken (not on trivet). Cook for 8/9 minutes.

items.title: Pear Wine
items.summary: Yum yum yum. Quarter the pears, then smash with end of pint glass (or potato masher). Add the sugar,…
items.content_html:
Yum yum yum.

Amount Ingredient
1 gallon (4 quarts) pears
4 1/2 cups sugar
1 qt boiling water
1/4 packet champagne yeast
1 package (1 oz) raisins (yeast nutrient)
1 cup black tea (tannin)
1/4 cup lemon juice

 Quarter the pears, then smash with end of pint glass (or potato masher).

Add the sugar, stir. Let stand for 6-12 hours as sugar extracts juices naturally.

Then add 1 qt boiling water. Let stand until room temperature.

Add the awkened yeast (in lukewarm water 5-10 minutes), raisins, tea, and lemon juice.

 

Made:

1/11/20 - with ~3 Bartlett Pears, 6 Best Ever Pears

items.title: Green Chile Pork Carnitas
items.summary: Attempt at Torchy's Green Chile Pork tacos Saute pork in 2 tbs olive oil. Mix rub (salt, pepper, green…
items.content_html:
Attempt at Torchy's Green Chile Pork tacos

Amount Ingredient
2 tbs olive oil
1 tbs lime juice
1 blood orange
1 regular orange
1tbs cumin
4 tsp (or 1 1/3 tbs) green chili powder
1 tsp pepper
1 tsp salt
1 cup water
3-4 lb pork butt roast

Saute pork in 2 tbs olive oil.

Mix rub (salt, pepper, green chili powder, cumin), then rub onto sauteed pork.

Add oranges, lime juice, and water to instant pot. Then put pork back in.

Cook for 60 minutes.

Notes: if on trivet makes good meat, but doesn't get the flavors. Maybe put directly in sauce or powder the green chiles on meat after shredding the pork.

items.title: Cauliflower Mexican "Nachos"
items.summary: A nacho delight using seasoned cauliflower instead of chips. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine oil, chili powder, cumin,…
items.content_html:
A nacho delight using seasoned cauliflower instead of chips.

Amount Ingredient
3 tbs grapeseed oil
3/4 tsp chili powder
3/4 tsp cumin
3/4 tsp onion powder
1/4 tsp salt
8 cups cauliflower (chopped)
several sprigs cilantro
1/8 chopped red onion
1 can black beans
1 1/2 cups shredded chicken (pre-cooked)
desired level Mexican cheese

 Preheat oven to 400 degrees.

Combine oil, chili powder, cumin, onion powder, salt in large bowl. Toss in cauliflower to coat. 

Spread cauliflower on pre-sprayed baking sheet and cook for 15-20 minutes (15 in gas oven).

When cauliflower starting to brown, pull out of oven, add black beans, chicken (if cold), red onion, and cheese. Bake until cheese melted (~5 min.).

Top with cilantro and / or salsa.

items.title: Rhubarb Wine
items.summary: A winter vegetable in a fun new form. (https://practicalselfreliance.com/rhubarb-wine) Made: 1/5/20 - chopped up 4 large stems from Central…
items.content_html:
A winter vegetable in a fun new form. (https://practicalselfreliance.com/rhubarb-wine)

4 stems rhubarb
  sugar
  black tea
  lemon juice
  raisins
   
   

 

Made:

1/5/20 - chopped up 4 large stems from Central Market. Placed in red bowl with significant sugar (unmeasured) for 3 days, mixing occasionally. Moved to single quart vessel on 3rd day. Filled almost halfway with sugary mixture, water, tannin, etc. the rest of the way.
